unnormalised: ## Ditch the Cassette, Embrace the Stream: Music in the Age of the Algorithm
normalised: ## Ditch the Cassette, Embrace the Stream: Music in the Age of the Algorithm

unnormalised: Remember the days of meticulously curating your cassette tapes, spending hours rewinding and fast-forwarding? Ah, nostalgia! But let's be real, friends, music streaming has revolutionized how we consume our favourite tunes. From Bollywood hits to classical ragas, everything is now just a tap away.
normalised: Remember the days of meticulously curating your cassette tapes, spending hours rewinding and fast-forwarding? Ah, nostalgia! But let's be real, friends, music streaming has revolutionized how we consume our favourite tunes. From Bollywood hits to classical ragas, everything is now just a tap away.

unnormalised: Gone are the days of scouring Chor Bazaar for rare vinyls or waiting weeks for HMV to stock that new Lata Mangeshkar album. Now, you can listen to AR Rahman’s latest soundtrack while travelling from Mumbai to Pune, without a single scratch or skip. Isn't technology amazing?
normalised: Gone are the days of scouring Chor Bazaar for rare vinyls or waiting weeks for H M V to stock that new Lata Mangeshkar album. Now, you can listen to A R Rahman’s latest soundtrack while travelling from Mumbai to Pune, without a single scratch or skip. Isn't technology amazing?

unnormalised: I remember when I first got Spotify. It felt like Ali Baba's cave, filled with musical treasures! I immediately created a playlist dedicated to songs from movies produced by Yash Raj Films. Talk about guilty pleasures!
normalised: I remember when I first got Spotify. It felt like Ali Baba's cave, filled with musical treasures! I immediately created a playlist dedicated to songs from movies produced by Yash Raj Films. Talk about guilty pleasures!

unnormalised: But streaming isn't just about convenience. It's democratized music, giving independent artists a platform to reach wider audiences. Think of the local band from IIT Bombay, "The Algorithm," suddenly finding fans across the country through SoundCloud. That's the power of accessibility!
normalised: But streaming isn't just about convenience. It's democratized music, giving independent artists a platform to reach wider audiences. Think of the local band from I I T Bombay, "The Algorithm," suddenly finding fans across the country through SoundCloud. That's the power of accessibility!

unnormalised: Of course, there are concerns about artist compensation and the dominance of a few major players. Debates about per-stream royalties continue, and it's crucial to support artists directly whenever possible – maybe buy their merch at the Kala Ghoda Arts Festival or contribute to their Patreon!
normalised: Of course, there are concerns about artist compensation and the dominance of a few major players. Debates about per-stream royalties continue, and it's crucial to support artists directly whenever possible – maybe buy their merch at the Kala Ghoda Arts Festival or contribute to their Patreon!

unnormalised: Ultimately, though, music streaming is here to stay. It offers a vast library of music at our fingertips, shaping the way we discover, share, and experience the soundtrack of our lives. So, put on your headphones, fire up your favorite app, and let the music take you away. What are you listening to today? Let me know in the comments!
normalised: Ultimately, though, music streaming is here to stay. It offers a vast library of music at our fingertips, shaping the way we discover, share, and experience the soundtrack of our lives. So, put on your headphones, fire up your favorite app, and let the music take you away. What are you listening to today? Let me know in the comments!
